result.execSummary:
The defendant Meng Vang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: with huber and serve the first 90 days, less any good time credit, in jail and balance on electronic monitor, if eligible - stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay costs and DNA surcharge and Domestic surcharge. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Pay costs and DNA surcharge and Domestic surchage.

Provide DNA sample.
No abusive contact with victim K.Xiong.
Apology letter to victim, give to Agent first.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Meng Vang
Current: 2316 Jefferson Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 11-23-2015)
Prior: 2416 Ellis Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481

9:49 a.m. Defendant Meng Vang in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases 14CM453 (revoked VIP) and 15CF262 are heard today.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF262: Count 2, 3, & 4: No Contest to each.
14CM453: 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF262: Count 2, 3, & 4
14CM453:.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 15CF262 Count 1 is dismissed and read-in.

ADA Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Redfield concurs with joint recommendation. 

Defendant make statements to the Court.

BY THE COURT:*****PROBATION***
15CF262 Count 2: I/S Sentence: 180 days jail, with huber and serve the first 90 days, less any good time credit, in jail and balance on electronic monitor, if eligible - stayed
18 mo Probation
Conditions: 
Pay costs and DNA surcharge and Domestic surchage.
Defendant ordered to have a Mental Health Assessment/Psychological Evaluation and to comply with any recommended treatment.
Provide DNA sample.
No abusive contact with victim K.Xiong.
Apology letter to victim, give to Agent first.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.

15CF262 Count 3: I/S Sentence: 90 days jail, concurrent with 15CF262 Count 2 - stayed
18 mo Probation, concurrent with 15CF262 Count 2.
Comply with same conditions as stated in Count 2.
Pay costs and Domestic Abuse surcharge.

15CF262 Count 4:I/S Sentence: 120 days jail, concurrent with 15CF262 Count 2 - stayed
18 mo Probation, concurrent with 15CF262 Count 2 and 3.
Comply with same conditions as stated in Count 1.
Pay costs. 

14CM453 VIP revoked:
 I/S Sentence: 90 days jail with huber and serve the first 90 days, less any good time credit, in jail and balance on electronic monitor, if eligible , concurrent with 15CF262 Count 1 - stayed
18 mo Probation, concurrent with 15CF262 Count 1:
Comply with same conditions as stated in 15CF262 Count 1.
Pay costs and Domestic surcharge.

No jail credit.

Defendant Meng Vang in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard:  Motion hearing on 14CM453 and PTC on 15CF262
11:36 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Officer T. James is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Constable. 
Witness identifies the defendant. 

Atty Constable asks the Court to take judicial notice of the DPA in 14CM453. 
BY THE COURT:  Court takes judicial notice of the DPA and it's conditions. 
Court questions Atty Constable. 
Atty Redfield makes arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: Court makes judicial notice of all the conditions. 

K.X. is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Redfield. 
Cross exam by Atty Constable. 

Atty Constable makes final arguments to the Court. 
Atty Redfield makes final arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  Court finds there was probable cause for the defendant to be arrested for a Domestic Abuse incident. 
Court finds state has met its burden of proof, grants the states motion to vacate the DPA and reinstate proceedings which will result in the Judgment of Conviction being entered for the disorderly conduct case.  

Court questions the status of 15CF262.  
Atty Constable asks to schedule that file for an additional pretrial conference and 14CM353 for a status conference on the same day.  
Atty Redfield concurs. 

BY THE COURT:  Court does not order the entry of Judgment (14CM453) to wait for the outcome of the PTC/STC. 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.

9:07 a.m. Defendant Meng Vang in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Redfield was not aware of todays motion. Clerk added Atty Redfield as he states he is repesenting the Defendant. Matter rescheduled to allow time for Atty Redfield to consult with his client.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 11:30 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 11:30 am.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Meng Vang in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Defendant Meng Vang in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Bond Continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Meng Vang in court with attorney Jared Redfield. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
$1,500 cash bond (already posted): No contact with Ka Xiong.
